                      Hi again,

Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote :
| > If I understood your paper well, you first evolve the topology of the
| > NN with HyperNeat then fix the topoloy and only evolve the weights. Am
| > I right ?

| The topology of the NN is fixed throughout the experiment. The only things
| being evolved are the link weights. First the link weights are evolved with
| HyperNEAT and then they are further evolved with FT-NEAT.

OK, I thought that, in Hyperneat, links with near-zero weights were
removed. In your case, FT-NEAT can change these near-zero links and
give them back a significant value (if it's useful).

Did you try to remove these near-zero weights before running FT-NEAT?
It could improve the search of FT-NEAT by reducing the size of the
search space (but some variations would become impossible).

Best regards,
--
